title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 30 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 30.

questions.question: Who did Hezekiah send letters to, inviting them to keep the Passover at Jerusalem?
options: All Israel and Judah, Ephraim and Manasseh
Only Judah
Only Israel
The kings of Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: All Israel and Judah, Ephraim and Manasseh
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:1 states that Hezekiah sent letters to all Israel and Judah, including Ephraim and Manasseh, to come to Jerusalem to keep the Passover.

questions.question: In which month did Hezekiah and the congregation plan to keep the Passover?
options: Second month
First month
Third month
Fourth month
questions.correctAnswer: Second month
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 30:2, the king, princes, and congregation decided to keep the Passover in the second month.

questions.question: Why could they not keep the Passover at the usual time?
options: Priests were not sanctified and people had not gathered
There was no Passover feast prepared
The king was absent
They were at war
questions.correctAnswer: Priests were not sanctified and people had not gathered
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:3 explains they could not keep it at the usual time because the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently and the people had not gathered.

questions.question: What did the king and all the congregation do after deciding to keep the Passover in the second month?
options: Established a decree for proclamation throughout Israel
Canceled the Passover
Sent gifts to Assyria
Built new altars
questions.correctAnswer: Established a decree for proclamation throughout Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:5 states that they established a decree to proclaim throughout Israel that everyone should come to keep the Passover at Jerusalem.

questions.question: What did the letters sent by the king and princes urge the children of Israel to do?
options: Turn again unto the LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel
Build new temples
Fight against Assyria
Offer more sacrifices than before
questions.correctAnswer: Turn again unto the LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 30:6, the letters commanded the children of Israel to turn again to the LORD God of their fathers.

questions.question: How did some cities like those in Ephraim and Manasseh respond to the king’s message?
options: They laughed and mocked the messengers
They immediately obeyed
They sent gifts
They remained silent
questions.correctAnswer: They laughed and mocked the messengers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:10 says the posts passing through Ephraim and Manasseh were laughed to scorn and mocked.

questions.question: Which tribes humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem despite the mocking?
options: Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun
Judah and Benjamin
Levi and Simeon
Ephraim and Dan
questions.correctAnswer: Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:11 records that divers of Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem.

questions.question: What did the people do to the altars in Jerusalem before killing the Passover?
options: Took them away and cast them into the brook Kidron
Sacrificed animals on them
Decorated them with gold
Rebuilt them
questions.correctAnswer: Took them away and cast them into the brook Kidron
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:14 explains the people removed the altars and cast them into the brook Kidron.

questions.question: True or False: The priests and Levites were ashamed and sanctified themselves before bringing burnt offerings.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:15 states the priests and Levites were ashamed, sanctified themselves, and brought burnt offerings.

questions.question: Who had the charge of killing the Passovers for those who were not clean?
options: The Levites
The priests
The king
The elders
questions.correctAnswer: The Levites
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:17 says the Levites were responsible for killing the Passovers for those not sanctified.

questions.question: What did Hezekiah do for those who had not cleansed themselves properly but still ate the Passover?
options: He prayed that the LORD would pardon them
He punished them
He ignored their actions
He expelled them from Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: He prayed that the LORD would pardon them
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:18 records Hezekiah's prayer asking the LORD to pardon everyone who prepared their heart to seek God, despite uncleanness.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD hearkened to Hezekiah and healed the people.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:20 confirms that the LORD listened to Hezekiah and healed the people.

questions.question: How many days did the children of Israel keep the feast of unleavened bread with gladness?
options: Seven days
Three days
Fourteen days
One day
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:21 states that the feast was kept for seven days with great gladness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hezekiah gave to the congregation a thousand ______ and seven thousand sheep.
options: bullocks
goats
camels
doves
questions.correctAnswer: bullocks
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:24 records Hezekiah gave a thousand bullocks and seven thousand sheep to the congregation.

questions.question: True or False: There was great joy in Jerusalem like never before since the time of Solomon.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:26 confirms the great joy in Jerusalem had not been like this since Solomon's time.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 30 teach us about the importance of obedience and unity in worship?
options: By showing the king and congregation's collective decision to keep the Passover together
By emphasizing individual prayer only without communal gatherings
By instructing people to worship in their own homes separately
By requiring only priests to observe Passover
questions.correctAnswer: By showing the king and congregation's collective decision to keep the Passover together
questions.explanation: The passage describes Hezekiah and all the congregation in Jerusalem deciding together to keep the Passover (2 Chronicles 30:2, 30:4, 30:12). This demonstrates the biblical principle of unity and obedience in coming together to worship God.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feeling unworthy to approach God due to past failures. Based on 2 Chronicles 30, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God is gracious and merciful and will not turn away those who sincerely return to Him
Only perfect people can approach God without fault
God will reject those who have failed repeatedly
We must first cleanse ourselves perfectly before God listens
questions.correctAnswer: God is gracious and merciful and will not turn away those who sincerely return to Him
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Chronicles 30:9 and 30:20 reveal God's willingness to show compassion and hear prayers when people turn to Him, emphasizing His grace and mercy toward repentant hearts.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 30 illustrate the role of prayer and intercession in overcoming spiritual unpreparedness?
options: Hezekiah prayed for those who were not fully sanctified and God healed the people
Hezekiah ignored those not sanctified and only allowed perfect people to worship
The priests condemned those not clean without prayer
The people were left to repent on their own without intercession
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah prayed for those who were not fully sanctified and God healed the people
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 30:18-20, despite many not being fully cleansed, Hezekiah's prayer led to God's healing, highlighting the power of intercession and grace in spiritual discipline.

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 30 teach about responding to mockery or rejection when sharing the Gospel?
options: Some laughed and mocked the messengers, but others humbled themselves and responded positively
All people accepted the message immediately without resistance
Mockers were immediately punished by God
The messengers stopped preaching after the mockery
questions.correctAnswer: Some laughed and mocked the messengers, but others humbled themselves and responded positively
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Chronicles 30:10-11 show that while many mocked the king’s message, some humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem, teaching perseverance and humility in evangelism.

questions.question: A believer is wondering how to maintain integrity in worship and daily life. What example from 2 Chronicles 30 can you share?
options: The people removed unauthorized altars and sanctified themselves before worship
They worshiped with old altars and unclean practices
Only priests were responsible for holiness, not the people
They worshiped quietly without any offerings
questions.correctAnswer: The people removed unauthorized altars and sanctified themselves before worship
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:14-17 describes how the people took away improper altars and the priests and Levites sanctified themselves, showing the importance of purity and integrity in worship.

questions.question: How does this chapter teach about generosity and stewardship in supporting God's work?
options: Hezekiah and the princes gave thousands of bullocks and sheep to support the feast
The people were asked to fast and give nothing
Only priests gave offerings, not the king or princes
The feast was kept without any sacrifices or offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah and the princes gave thousands of bullocks and sheep to support the feast
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Chronicles 30:24 show King Hezekiah and the princes generously giving many animals for offerings, illustrating stewardship and sacrificial giving for God’s work.

questions.question: What biblical principle about humility and repentance can be learned from the response of some tribes in 2 Chronicles 30?
options: Some tribes humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem to obey God
All tribes rejected the invitation without exception
The tribes only obeyed after being forced
No tribe responded to the king's message
questions.correctAnswer: Some tribes humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem to obey God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:11 shows that despite some mocking, divers of Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun humbled themselves and came, teaching the value of humility in returning to God.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 30, God only accepts worship that is perfectly clean and without any impurity.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:18-20 shows that God heard Hezekiah’s prayer and healed the people even though many were not fully cleansed, demonstrating God's grace toward sincere worshippers.

questions.question: True or False: The celebration of the Passover in 2 Chronicles 30 was marked by great joy and praise to God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Chronicles 30:21, 30:25-26 describe the people rejoicing and praising God with gladness, showing the joy that comes from faithful worship and obedience.

questions.question: A believer asks how to cultivate a heart ready to seek God even if imperfect. Based on 2 Chronicles 30, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God pardons anyone who prepares their heart to seek Him
God only accepts those who are fully purified first
Seeking God is only for priests and Levites
Imperfect hearts cannot approach God
questions.correctAnswer: God pardons anyone who prepares their heart to seek Him
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:19 states that the Lord pardons those who prepare their hearts to seek Him, emphasizing sincerity over ritual perfection.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 30 illustrate the importance of spiritual leadership and teaching in the community?
options: Hezekiah spoke comfortably to the Levites who taught good knowledge of the Lord
The king ignored the Levites and ruled alone
The priests were not involved in teaching or guiding the people
The people learned only from foreign teachers
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah spoke comfortably to the Levites who taught good knowledge of the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:22 shows the king encouraging the Levites who taught the people, highlighting the role of godly leadership in spiritual growth.

questions.question: What lesson about perseverance in faith can be learned from the assembly's decision to extend the feast?
options: The assembly took counsel to keep another seven days with gladness
They ended the feast earlier due to exhaustion
The feast was shortened because people lost interest
Only the priests continued the feast, not the people
questions.correctAnswer: The assembly took counsel to keep another seven days with gladness
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:23 shows the congregation’s desire to prolong worship in gladness, illustrating perseverance and dedication in spiritual discipline.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hezekiah sent letters to all Israel and Judah, including _____ and Manasseh, inviting them to keep the Passover.
options: Ephraim
Levi
Judah
Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: Ephraim
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:1 states that Hezekiah wrote letters to Ephraim and Manasseh, inviting them to Jerusalem to keep the Passover.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 30 encourage believers to avoid stubbornness in their spiritual walk?
options: By warning not to be stiffnecked like the fathers, but to yield to the Lord
By encouraging pride in one's own understanding
By avoiding repentance and continuing in sin
By ignoring God's sanctuary and commandments
questions.correctAnswer: By warning not to be stiffnecked like the fathers, but to yield to the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:8 warns against being stiffnecked like previous generations and encourages yielding oneself to God’s sanctified sanctuary, teaching humility and obedience.

questions.question: What biblical truth about God's faithfulness can be drawn from the statement that God would return to the remnant escaped from Assyria's hand?
options: God is gracious and promises restoration to those who turn back to Him
God abandons all who are taken captive
Only kings can be restored by God
God punishes the remnant without mercy
questions.correctAnswer: God is gracious and promises restoration to those who turn back to Him
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:6-9 shows God’s promise to return to the remnant who turn again to Him, affirming His faithfulness and mercy.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 30.

questions.question: What was the primary reason Hezekiah and the people of Israel and Judah could not keep the Passover at the appointed time?
options: The priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently
The king was away at war
The temple was under construction
The people were scattered by famine
questions.correctAnswer: The priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:3 explains that the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently, and the people had not gathered, so they could not keep the Passover at the appointed time.

questions.question: In sending letters to all Israel and Judah, including Ephraim and Manasseh, Hezekiah's invitation to keep the Passover is an example of which biblical theme?
options: Restoration of covenant community
Judgment on disobedience
Establishment of monarchy
Building of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Restoration of covenant community
questions.explanation: The invitation to all tribes to come to Jerusalem to keep Passover shows a restoration and unification theme consistent with covenant renewal (2 Chronicles 30:1, 5).

questions.question: What is the significance of the Passover being kept in the second month as opposed to the first month?
options: It was a delayed observance due to initial unpreparedness
It was a new tradition established by Hezekiah
It aligned with the Assyrian calendar
It symbolized a new covenant
questions.correctAnswer: It was a delayed observance due to initial unpreparedness
questions.explanation: The Passover was delayed to the second month because the priests and people were not ready at the appointed time (2 Chronicles 30:2-3).

questions.question: Which phrase in Hezekiah's letter calls the people to repentance and signals God's readiness to forgive and restore?
options: "Turn again unto the LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and he will return to the remnant of you"
"Prepare your hearts for war against the Assyrians"
"Build new altars to the LORD your God"
"Gather all your possessions and flee to Jerusalem"
questions.correctAnswer: "Turn again unto the LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and he will return to the remnant of you"
questions.explanation: This phrase (2 Chronicles 30:6) explicitly calls for repentance and promises God's return to His people, reflecting the covenant relationship.

questions.question: How did some of the northern tribes respond to the invitation to keep Passover in Jerusalem?
options: They mocked and laughed the messengers to scorn
They eagerly accepted and came immediately
They sent gifts but did not come themselves
They declared independence from Judah
questions.correctAnswer: They mocked and laughed the messengers to scorn
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:10 states that the messengers were mocked and laughed to scorn in many cities of Ephraim and Manasseh.

questions.question: Which tribes are specifically mentioned as humbling themselves and coming to Jerusalem to keep the Passover?
options: Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun
Judah, Benjamin, and Levi
Naphtali, Gad, and Reuben
Ephraim, Simeon, and Issachar
questions.correctAnswer: Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:11 mentions divers of Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun who humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem.

questions.question: What role did the Levites have concerning those who were not sanctified when eating the Passover?
options: They killed the Passover lambs for those who were not clean
They barred them from entering the temple
They led them in confession and fasting
They sent them away from Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: They killed the Passover lambs for those who were not clean
questions.explanation: Verse 17 explains that the Levites had the charge of killing the Passover lambs for everyone who was not clean to sanctify them unto the LORD.

questions.question: Hezekiah's prayer for those who ate the Passover without purification reflects which theological principle?
options: God's mercy for those preparing their hearts sincerely
Strict legalism without exception
Exclusion of all who are unclean
Immediate judgment without intercession
questions.correctAnswer: God's mercy for those preparing their hearts sincerely
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:18-19 shows Hezekiah praying for God's pardon for those who prepared their hearts to seek God, even if unclean, indicating God’s mercy.

questions.question: The great joy and singing with loud instruments by the Levites and priests during the feast symbolize what broader biblical theme?
options: Restoration and celebration of covenant fellowship
The establishment of a new political kingdom
The beginning of exile
The building of new altars
questions.correctAnswer: Restoration and celebration of covenant fellowship
questions.explanation: The rejoicing and praise (2 Chronicles 30:21) reflect restoration of worship and covenant relationship with God, a recurring biblical motif.

questions.question: How does the action of removing altars and casting them into the brook Kidron relate to broader Deuteronomic reforms?
options: It reflects the centralization of worship in Jerusalem
It introduces polytheistic worship practices
It supports local high places for sacrifice
It indicates a rejection of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects the centralization of worship in Jerusalem
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:14 shows removal of altars, consistent with Deuteronomy 12’s command to centralize worship in the place God chooses, Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 30, the Passover feast lasted only the prescribed seven days without extension.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The assembly took counsel to keep an additional seven days, extending the feast to fourteen days (2 Chronicles 30:23).

questions.question: What was the significance of the blessing the priests and Levites gave to the people at the end of the chapter?
options: It represented a divine confirmation and acceptance of the people's worship
It marked the end of the monarchy
It was an appeal for military aid against Assyria
It was a call to exile
questions.correctAnswer: It represented a divine confirmation and acceptance of the people's worship
questions.explanation: The priests' blessing (2 Chronicles 30:27) symbolizes God's acceptance of the people's repentance and worship, with the prayer ascending to heaven.

questions.question: The phrase 'be not ye stiffnecked' in Hezekiah's letter is an allusion to which recurring biblical motif?
options: The stubbornness of Israel leading to exile
The building of the Tower of Babel
The giving of the law at Sinai
The calling of Abraham
questions.correctAnswer: The stubbornness of Israel leading to exile
questions.explanation: Hezekiah's exhortation (2 Chronicles 30:8) recalls Israel's stubbornness in the wilderness which led to judgment, urging repentance.

questions.question: Hezekiah's giving of bullocks and sheep, along with the princes' contribution, demonstrates what aspect of leadership in the biblical context?
options: Generosity and responsibility in facilitating communal worship
Political oppression of the people
Neglect of religious duties
Military conquest
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity and responsibility in facilitating communal worship
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:24 shows Hezekiah and princes providing many animals for the sacrifices, highlighting their role in supporting worship.

questions.question: Which historical context helps explain the urgency in Hezekiah's call to repentance and Passover observance?
options: The threat and aftermath of Assyrian invasion
The Babylonian exile
The conquest of Canaan
The reign of King David
questions.correctAnswer: The threat and aftermath of Assyrian invasion
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:6 references deliverance from the kings of Assyria, situating the call to repentance amid Assyrian threats.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the primary reason King Hezekiah sent letters to all Israel and Judah to come to Jerusalem?
options: To keep the Passover unto the LORD God of Israel
To fight against the kings of Assyria
To build new altars in Jerusalem
To establish a new sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: To keep the Passover unto the LORD God of Israel
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:1 states that Hezekiah sent letters to all Israel and Judah to come to the house of the LORD at Jerusalem to keep the Passover. This highlights the importance of corporate worship and covenant renewal. Similarly, Exodus 12:1-28 commands the Israelites to observe the Passover, and Jesus fulfills this in Luke 22:7-20 during the Last Supper.

questions.question: Why was the Passover kept in the second month instead of the first month as prescribed?
options: Because the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently and the people were not gathered
Because the king was not ready
Because of a famine in the land
Because the sanctuary was under repair
questions.correctAnswer: Because the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently and the people were not gathered
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:3 explains the delay was due to the priests not being sanctified and the people not having gathered. This shows the necessity of holiness and preparation before approaching God, consistent with Leviticus 11:44, Hebrews 12:14, and 1 Peter 1:15-16.

questions.question: What was the king’s exhortation to the children of Israel to turn again to the LORD?
options: Turn again unto the LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and He will return to the remnant
Build new temples in every city
Offer sacrifices to foreign gods for protection
Prepare for war against Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: Turn again unto the LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and He will return to the remnant
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:6 records the king’s command to turn back to the LORD God of the patriarchs, promising God’s restoration to the remnant. This reflects God's covenant faithfulness as seen in Jeremiah 31:3, Isaiah 44:21-22, and Romans 11:26-27.

questions.question: According to Hezekiah’s message, what was the consequence of being like the fathers who trespassed against the LORD?
options: They were given up to desolation
They were blessed abundantly
They ruled over other nations
They were protected by angels
questions.correctAnswer: They were given up to desolation
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:7 warns not to be like their fathers who trespassed and were given up to desolation. This judgment theme is consistent with Deuteronomy 28:15-68, Psalm 89:30-34, and Hebrews 10:26-31 about the consequences of persistent sin.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'be not stiffnecked' in Hezekiah's message signify theologically?
options: Do not be stubborn but yield to the LORD to avert His wrath
Do not build altars in Jerusalem
Do not keep the Passover again
Do not trust in foreign alliances
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be stubborn but yield to the LORD to avert His wrath
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:8 exhorts the people not to be stiffnecked but to yield themselves to God, emphasizing repentance and submission to God’s holiness to turn away His wrath. This aligns with biblical calls to humility in Proverbs 3:34, Isaiah 66:2, and James 4:6-10.

questions.question: What does the chapter reveal about God's character when Hezekiah prayed for those who ate the Passover unclean?
options: The LORD is gracious and merciful and will pardon those seeking Him
The LORD is strict and will punish all disobedience immediately
The LORD only accepts sacrifices from the Levites
The LORD ignores prayers of the impure
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is gracious and merciful and will pardon those seeking Him
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:18-19 shows Hezekiah prayed for those who were unclean yet sought God, and God heard and healed the people (v.20). This highlights God’s grace and mercy as seen in Psalm 103:8, Lamentations 3:22-23, Ephesians 2:4-5, and 1 John 1:9.

questions.question: How did the people respond to the king’s proclamation to keep the Passover?
options: Some mocked the messengers, while others humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem
Everyone immediately obeyed without question
All refused and fled the land
They built new altars in their cities instead
questions.correctAnswer: Some mocked the messengers, while others humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:10-11 records that some laughed and mocked the king’s posts, but others humbled themselves and attended the feast. This tension between rejection and humility reflects responses to God’s call seen in Jonah 3:5-10 and Acts 13:46-48.

questions.question: What specific action did the people take regarding the altars in Jerusalem during the feast?
options: They took away all the altars and cast them into the brook Kidron
They built more altars for incense
They ignored the altars and worshipped idols
They consecrated the altars with new offerings
questions.correctAnswer: They took away all the altars and cast them into the brook Kidron
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:14 states the people removed the altars and altars for incense and threw them into the brook Kidron, signifying purification and rejection of idolatry. This purification is consistent with Exodus 34:13-14, Jeremiah 7:9-11, and 1 Corinthians 10:14.

questions.question: What role did the Levites play during the Passover celebration according to this chapter?
options: They killed the passovers for those not sanctified and led praises unto the LORD
They were excluded from the celebration
They only observed silently
They led the people to war
questions.correctAnswer: They killed the passovers for those not sanctified and led praises unto the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:17 and 21 describe how the Levites took charge of killing the Passover for unclean people and praised the LORD daily with loud instruments. This reflects their priestly mediatory role per Numbers 3:6-10 and 1 Chronicles 15:16.

questions.question: What was the significance of the people eating the Passover without being fully cleansed?
options: Hezekiah prayed for them, and the LORD pardoned those who sought Him sincerely
They were immediately punished by exile
They were disqualified from the feast
They were required to make double offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah prayed for them, and the LORD pardoned those who sought Him sincerely
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:18-20 shows that though many ate the Passover unclean, Hezekiah prayed for them and God healed them, demonstrating God’s mercy beyond ritual purity, consistent with Hosea 6:6, Matthew 9:13, and Romans 3:23-24.

questions.question: How long did the feast of unleavened bread last during Hezekiah’s time, including the additional days?
options: Fourteen days in total
Seven days only
Three days only
Twenty-one days in total
questions.correctAnswer: Fourteen days in total
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:21 and 30:23 explain the feast was kept seven days initially and then an additional seven days, totaling fourteen days. This extended celebration shows zeal for God’s covenant and is linked with Exodus 12:15 and Leviticus 23:6-8.

questions.question: What offerings did King Hezekiah and the princes provide for the congregation to support the feast?
options: Hezekiah gave a thousand bullocks and seven thousand sheep; princes gave a thousand bullocks and ten thousand sheep
Hezekiah gave only grain offerings
The princes gave gold and silver only
They gave no offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Hezekiah gave a thousand bullocks and seven thousand sheep; princes gave a thousand bullocks and ten thousand sheep
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:24 details the large number of animal offerings given by Hezekiah and the princes to facilitate the feast, underscoring the importance of sacrifice in covenant renewal as seen in Leviticus 1-7 and Hebrews 10:1-10.

questions.question: What was the mood and response of the whole assembly during the feast in Jerusalem?
options: They rejoiced with great joy, which had not been seen since Solomon’s time
They mourned because of sin
They remained indifferent
They were fearful and silent
questions.correctAnswer: They rejoiced with great joy, which had not been seen since Solomon’s time
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:25-26 records great joy in Jerusalem, unparalleled since Solomon’s reign, reflecting the restoration and unity of God’s people, similar to Nehemiah 8:10 and Psalm 126:3.

questions.question: What was the significance of the priests and Levites blessing the people at the end of the festival?
options: Their voice was heard, and their prayer came up to God’s holy dwelling place
They cursed the disobedient
They declared war on enemies
They closed the temple gates permanently
questions.correctAnswer: Their voice was heard, and their prayer came up to God’s holy dwelling place
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:27 emphasizes the priestly intercession and blessing, showing the mediatory role of priests whose prayers ascend to heaven, as also seen in Numbers 6:24-26, Psalm 141:2, and Hebrews 7:25.

questions.question: What theological theme is highlighted by the people’s assembly to keep the feast 'with one heart' as mentioned in this chapter?
options: Unity and obedience to God’s commandment
Division and rebellion
Political alliance against Assyria
Establishment of a new religion
questions.correctAnswer: Unity and obedience to God’s commandment
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 30:12 states God gave them one heart to obey the king’s command by His word, highlighting ecclesiology—the unity of God’s people in covenant obedience—as reflected in Psalm 133:1, John 17:21, and Ephesians 4:3-6.
